name: Khichdi
instructions: Wash rice and dal.
Pressure cook with 3 cups water, turmeric, and salt.
Prepare tadka with ghee and cumin, add to khichdi.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Easily digestible, grounding yet light, perfect for detoxification

name: Oats Porridge with Fruits

ingredients.name: Milk (or almond milk)
ingredients.note: Cooling or neutral depending on type

instructions: Boil oats in milk until soft.
Top with chopped fruits and cinnamon.
Serve warm.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Nourishing and grounding, provides sustained energy

name: Vegetable Upma
instructions: Roast semolina until light golden.
Cook vegetables in water with salt.
Add semolina slowly, stir until thickened.
Top with ghee.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Light yet satisfying, easily digestible breakfast option

name: Mung Bean Soup
instructions: Soak mung beans for 4 hours.
Cook until soft with turmeric and salt.
Prepare tadka with cumin and ginger, add to soup.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Perfect detox food, light yet protein-rich

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan.
Add vegetables and stir-fry quickly.
Season with soy sauce and serve warm.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Light, easy to digest, metabolism boosting

name: Masoor Dal (Red Lentil Curry)
instructions: Wash and cook lentils with turmeric until soft.
Prepare tadka with onion, tomato, cumin.
Mix into dal and simmer 5 minutes.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Protein-rich, warming, can increase Pitta if consumed excessively

name: Lassi (Sweet Yogurt Drink)
instructions: Blend yogurt with water until smooth.
Add sugar and cardamom powder.
Serve chilled (not ice-cold).

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Cooling, nourishing, excellent for Pitta conditions

name: Vegetable Pulao
instructions: Soak rice for 20 minutes.
Sauté spices and vegetables in ghee.
Add rice and water, cook until fluffy.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Aromatic, nourishing, balanced one-pot meal

name: Lentil Salad with Lemon Dressing
instructions: Cook lentils until soft but not mushy.
Mix with chopped vegetables.
Add lemon juice, olive oil, and salt.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Light, refreshing, but lemon and tomato may aggravate Pitta

name: Kheer (Rice Pudding)
instructions: Cook rice in milk until soft.
Add sugar, cardamom, and nuts.
Simmer until creamy.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Rich, nourishing, comfort food that builds Ojas

name: Vegetable Upma
instructions: Dry roast semolina until lightly golden.
In ghee, temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, and add chopped vegetables.
Add water, salt, and simmer until vegetables soften.
Add semolina slowly, stirring to avoid lumps.
Cook until fluffy, garnish with coriander.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Light yet satisfying breakfast that provides sustained energy and balances Vata

health_benefits: Provides sustained energy in the morning
Improves digestion when taken with ghee

name: Palak Paneer

ingredients.name: Spinach (Palak)
ingredients.note: Cooling, balances Pitta, rich in iron

instructions: Blanch spinach and puree.
Sauté cumin, ginger, and garlic in ghee.
Add paneer cubes and cook lightly.
Mix spinach puree, add salt and spices.
Simmer until creamy and serve hot.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Rich, cooling dish that balances Pitta but can increase Kapha due to paneer

health_benefits: Rich source of calcium and iron

name: Khichdi

ingredients.name: Moong dal
ingredients.note: Laghu, easy to digest, balances Tridosha

instructions: Wash rice and dal thoroughly.
In a pot, heat ghee, add cumin, ginger, and turmeric.
Add rice and dal, stir for a minute.
Add 4 cups water and simmer until soft.
Serve warm with ghee.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Perfect detox food that balances all doshas and is easily digestible

name: Masoor Dal Curry
instructions: Wash and pressure cook lentils until soft.
In ghee, sauté cumin, turmeric, and chopped tomatoes.
Add cooked lentils, salt, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Light yet nourishing protein source that strengthens without heaviness

name: Curd Rice
instructions: Mix cooled cooked rice with curd.
In ghee, temper mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Pour seasoning over rice-curd mixture.
Serve with pickle or papad.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Excellent cooling meal for hot weather but can aggravate Vata in cold conditions

name: Vegetable Daliya (Broken Wheat Porridge)
instructions: Roast daliya lightly in ghee.
Add vegetables, water, and spices.
Pressure cook until soft.
Serve warm with fresh coriander.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: High fiber content makes it excellent for weight management and Kapha balance

health_benefits: Balances Kapha and supports weight management

name: Tomato Rasam
instructions: Boil tomatoes and tamarind pulp in water.
Add spices (pepper, cumin) and curry leaves.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot as soup or with rice.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Excellent digestive stimulant that clears congestion and improves appetite

name: Lemon Rice
instructions: Mix cooled cooked rice with lemon juice and salt.
In ghee, temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chilies.
Mix seasoning into rice and serve.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Refreshing summer meal that's light yet satisfying with digestive spices

name: Oats Vegetable Chilla
instructions: Mix oats flour with water and spices into a batter.
Add grated vegetables.
Pour onto a hot pan, cook both sides like a pancake.
Serve with chutney.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: High fiber breakfast that's filling yet light, excellent for weight management

health_benefits: High in fiber, good for digestion

name: Moong Dal Chilla
instructions: Soak moong dal for 4 hours, grind into a batter.
Mix with onion, coriander, chili, and ginger.
Cook on a hot pan until golden on both sides.
Serve hot with chutney.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Light yet protein-rich, easily digestible, suitable for all doshas

name: Avocado Toast
instructions: Toast the sourdough bread.
Mash avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Spread on toast and serve immediately.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Grounding and nourishing for Vata, but heavy for Kapha

name: Spiced Tea (Chai)
instructions: Boil water with spices and tea leaves.
Add milk and simmer for 5 minutes.
Strain and serve hot with a sweetener if desired.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Warming and stimulating, excellent for Kapha, but can increase Pitta due to heat

name: Tomato Soup
instructions: Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil.
Add chopped tomatoes and basil, cook until soft.
Blend to a smooth consistency.
Season with salt and pepper, serve hot.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Appetite-stimulating, light soup that can increase Pitta due to sour taste

name: Sattvic Ghee Roast
instructions: Roast rice and mung dal in ghee for 5 minutes.
Add cumin seeds, then add 4 cups water.
Pressure cook until soft.
Serve hot with a dollop of fresh ghee.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A sattvic meal that calms the mind and nourishes all tissues

name: Kitchari (Tridoshic)
instructions: Wash rice and dal until water is clear.
Sauté spices and vegetables in ghee.
Add rice, dal, and 5-6 cups water.
Pressure cook until a soupy consistency is reached.
Serve with fresh ginger slices.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Easily digestible, detoxifying, and nourishing for all body tissues (Dhatus)

name: Spiced Buttermilk
instructions: Mix buttermilk, grated ginger, cumin powder, and salt.
Stir well and garnish with coriander leaves.
Serve at room temperature.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A light and digestive drink that balances all three doshas, especially after a heavy meal

name: Cumin Water
instructions: Boil cumin seeds in water.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Strain and drink warm throughout the day.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Excellent digestive aid that boosts metabolism and cleanses the digestive tract

name: Ginger Tea
instructions: Boil water and add grated ginger.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Strain into a cup.
Add honey once it cools down slightly.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Powerful digestive tonic that clears congestion but can increase Pitta if consumed excessively

name: Golden Milk (Turmeric Latte)
instructions: Warm milk in a saucepan.
Add turmeric, ginger, and black pepper.
Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring well.
Strain and serve warm with honey.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Highly medicinal drink that builds immunity and lubricates joints

name: Mint and Coriander Chutney
instructions: Blend all ingredients with a splash of water.
Add salt to taste and blend until smooth.
Serve with snacks or main meals.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Refreshing and light, aids digestion and cools the body

health_benefits: Rich in Vitamin C and K

name: Vegetable Biryani
instructions: Marinate vegetables in yogurt and spices for 30 minutes.
Cook rice until 70% done.
Layer rice and vegetables in a heavy-bottomed pot.
Cook on low flame until rice is fully cooked and aromatic.
Serve with raita.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A rich and heavy meal that is grounding for Vata but can aggravate Pitta and Kapha

name: Ragi Roti (Finger Millet Flatbread)
instructions: Mix ragi flour with warm water and salt to form a dough.
Roll into thin rotis.
Cook on a hot griddle until done on both sides.
Serve hot with ghee or curry.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: High in fiber and calcium, excellent for Pitta and Kapha, but can be drying for Vata

health_benefits: Excellent for diabetics due to low glycemic index

name: Cabbage Poriyal
instructions: Heat oil, temper mustard seeds and urad dal.
Add onion, saute until soft.
Add shredded cabbage, salt, and turmeric.
Cook until tender, add grated coconut.
Serve warm.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Light, drying vegetable dish that is great for Kapha but can increase Vata

name: Coconut Chutney
instructions: Blend all ingredients with water to a smooth paste.
Prepare a tempering of mustard seeds and curry leaves in oil.
Pour tempering over the chutney and serve.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Cooling and nourishing, great for Pitta, but its heavy nature can increase Kapha

name: Moong Dal Soup
instructions: Wash dal and cook in a pot with water, turmeric, and salt.
Cook until very soft and creamy.
In a separate pan, prepare a tempering with ghee and cumin powder.
Pour tempering over the soup.
Serve warm.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: The classic Ayurvedic cleanse food, extremely easy to digest and balances all doshas

name: Beetroot Halwa
instructions: Roast grated beetroot in ghee until moisture evaporates.
Add milk and sugar, cook until thick.
Add cardamom powder and nuts.
Serve warm or chilled.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A rich, nourishing dessert that is excellent for high Pitta but can increase Kapha

name: Sweet Potato and Spinach Curry
instructions: Sauté ginger and cumin powder in oil.
Add chopped sweet potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Add coconut milk and water, simmer until sweet potatoes are tender.
Add spinach, cook for 2 minutes and serve hot.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A nourishing and grounding meal that's perfect for Vata but can be too heavy for Kapha

health_benefits: Rich in fiber and Vitamin A

name: Lentil Soup
instructions: Sauté carrots and celery in a pot.
Add lentils, vegetable broth, and thyme.
Simmer for 30-40 minutes until lentils are soft.
Season with salt and pepper.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Light and drying, excellent for Kapha, but can be too dry and light for Vata

name: Oatmeal with Nuts and Seeds
instructions: Cook oats in water or milk until soft.
Add nuts, seeds, and maple syrup.
Serve warm.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A very heavy and nourishing breakfast that is great for Vata but can be too heavy for Kapha

name: Spiced Apple Sauce
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a saucepan.
Cook until apples are soft and mushy.
Mash with a fork or blender.
Serve warm.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A light and cleansing snack that is great for Pitta and Kapha but can be too drying for Vata

name: Simple Mung Beans
instructions: Wash mung beans and cook in pressure cooker with water and turmeric.
In a separate pan, prepare a tempering of ghee and cumin.
Add tempering to cooked beans and mix well.
Serve hot.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: The perfect balancing food for all three doshas, easy to digest and detoxifying

health_benefits: High in plant-based protein and fiber

name: Moong Dal Dosa
instructions: Soak moong dal overnight, grind with ginger and chili.
Add salt and water to make a thin batter.
Pour batter on a hot tawa and spread thin.
Cook on both sides until golden brown.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A light and protein-rich breakfast that is easy to digest and suitable for all doshas

name: Rice Pudding with Saffron
instructions: Cook rice in milk until soft and creamy.
Add saffron and cardamom, simmer for 5 minutes.
Add sugar and stir until dissolved.
Serve warm or chilled.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A deeply nourishing and calming dessert that builds Ojas and soothes the mind

name: Roasted Vegetables with Herbs
instructions: Toss vegetables with olive oil, herbs, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast at 400°F (200°C) until tender and lightly browned.
Serve warm as a side dish.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A light and cleansing side dish that is great for Kapha and Pitta but can be too drying for Vata

name: Rice and Dal Idli
instructions: Soak rice and dal separately overnight.
Grind into a smooth batter, mix, and ferment for 8 hours.
Steam idlis in an idli cooker for 10-15 minutes.
Serve hot with sambar and chutney.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A light yet grounding breakfast that is great for Vata, but can increase Kapha due to its heavy nature

name: Sambar
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal until soft.
Cook vegetables with water and tamarind pulp.
Add sambar powder and cooked dal, simmer for 10 minutes.
Prepare a tempering and pour over the sambar.
Serve hot with idli or dosa.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A stimulating and cleansing curry that is great for Kapha but can increase Vata and Pitta

name: Cilantro Rice
instructions: Cook rice until done, fluff with a fork and let it cool.
Blend cilantro and ginger to a paste.
In a pan, heat ghee, add cumin seeds, and then the cilantro paste.
Sauté for a minute, add the cooked rice and mix well.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A light and flavorful rice dish that is cooling for Pitta but can increase Kapha

name: Roasted Chickpeas
instructions: Drain and pat chickpeas dry.
Toss with olive oil, paprika, cumin, and salt.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast at 400°F (200°C) for 20-30 minutes until crispy.
Serve as a snack.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A high-protein, drying snack that is great for Kapha but can be very aggravating for Vata

health_benefits: High in plant-based protein and fiber

name: Ashwagandha Milk
instructions: Warm almond milk gently, don't boil.
Whisk in ashwagandha and turmeric powders.
Let cool to drinking temperature.
Add honey and stir well before serving.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: Deeply nourishing and calming, builds Ojas

name: Spiced Ginger Biscuits
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix flour, ginger, and sugar.
Cut in ghee to form a crumbly mixture.
Add a splash of water to form a stiff dough.
Roll out, cut shapes, and bake for 15-20 minutes.

ayurvedic_properties.guna_properties: A warming and grounding snack that aids digestion but can increase Pitta due to heat and Kapha due to heaviness
